ygData.subject: Not so Simple?
ygData.msgSnippet: There s a bog a few clicks away, think you could fish out a torso sized boulder for me? Also, get a few pints of the black moss that grows on the trees there

Subject: Not so Simple?
Message-ID: <962n71+o2tk@...>

User-Agent: eGroups-EW/0.82
MIME-Version: 1.0

"There's a bog a few clicks away, think you could fish out a torso 
sized boulder for me? Also, get a few pints of the black moss that 
grows on the trees there"

Teltoli then noticed the guts lying over the ground, and the blood on 
her friend. She winced slightly, and averted her eyes from the pile 
of organs. Gross. The Fuzor then directed her eyes at Carnage's own 
eyes, and nodded, grinning slightly and taking off into the air again.

Once up in the air, she used her far-range scanners to spot the bog, 
and sped up her flying speed.

"Wonder what she needs black moss and a boulder for.." She mused to 
herself, more thinking than saying out loud because her words would 
be lost in the wind, at the speed she was going. "Can't use a boulder 
for cooking.."

After spotting the bog, she sighed and landed near it, so she 
wouldn't touch the bog itself. Looking round, Teltoli finally spotted 
a boulder, but could only see half due it being half buried in a 
shallow part. She wrinkled her nose, and decided it would be big 
enough for whatever Carnage needed. 

Rubbing a hand over her face, she groaned quietly and stepped into 
the bog, screwing up her face with disgust. But, she'd need to get 
used to this world again.. and if anybody thought she was a coward 
they'd either scorn her.. or kill her. 

The Fuzor got within a meter of the boulder, when she suddenly felt 
something shift under her, and she looked down, trying to spot 
whatever it was beneath the murky water. It shifted again, and 
suddenly she found herself falling another half meter down into the 
bog. She gave a yelp and a loud curse with shock, and then stopped 
and tried to calm her racing heart. Now up to her waist in bog, she 
climbed out of the hole the unstable floor had caused, and put a hand 
on the boulder.

She narrowed her eyes and pushed it, feeling it move ever so 
slightly. Teltoli put the other hand on the boulder and heaved, by it 
only moved at inch. Lowering her chin so she glared at it, she threw 
herself against it so it moved another three inches. She was glad she 
had found a way to move it.. until it rolled back into the self-
created pit it had made.

Teltoli growled with fustration and waded out of the bog, and glared 
at the boulder once again with her hands on her hips. She let her 
eyes roam around the bog, searching for the anything that could be of 
use. Her eyes alighted on a rather sturdy branch, and she picked it 
up. At the boulder once again, she positioned the branch at the 
bottom of the boulder and and it slid free, and rolled to the edge of 
the bog.

"I did it! I did it! Yes!" Teltoli shouted at the trees surrounding 
her, and grinned. It wasn't a very big victory, but it was fun. 
Tramping out of the bog once again, she flicked some water off her 
armour and rubbed her arm where it had been slightly bruised, by 
throwing herself against that rock.

Now, the boulder proposed a problem.. it had to be carried several 
clicks to where Carnage was. She glared again and hunted round the 
swamp for some vines. Once she had found them, she tied them securely 
about the boulder, especially underneath so they would slide easy.

Joining all the loose ends into one knot, she held the end of the 
vines and pulled with all her strength, and it nearly came flying 
straight at her! She yelped and dodged, and the boulder landed where 
her foot had been. Teltoli sighed and pulled it with less firepower 
this time, and it slid along smoothly, aided by the slippery vines on 
the bottom. 

After about ten minutes of solid pulling, she could see the clearing 
up ahead, and grinned. Finally! With one last heave she yanked the 
boulder into the clearing and it landed fairly close to the pile of 
organs.

"What on Earth do you need a boulder for anyway?" She breathed, 
sitting down on the boulder itself and putting her hands on her 
knees. "I'll get the black moss once I get my breath back!"
